tweet: In high-stakes dialogues, you’ve got to govern your emotions. The threat to the world from a nuclear nightmare with North Korea is so great, I honestly hoped for a breakthrough on denuclearization and ending the Korean War. It was not ripe. The President was right to walk away.

Great news for local and national parks: Yesterday the House passed a public lands package that includes permanent reauthorization of the Land and Water Conservation Fund and provisions that protect millions of acres of wilderness for multiple use opportunity

“We are excited to soon welcome the beautiful bronze statue of human rights icon Chief Standing Bear. We are meeting with the Architect of the Capitol shortly. The statue is likely to be placed in the spring.”
A number of my colleagues and I today attended the funeral of Congressman Walter Jones of North Carolina­­––a wonderful gentleman, an independent-minded statesman, and my friend.

So good to see my friend and Ponca Tribal Chairman Larry Wright, as we make plans in DC for the arrival of the statue of civil rights icon, Chief Standing Bear, which will hold pride of place in the Capitol’s Statuary Hall. pic.twitter.com/DmY5hmPchF

Great economic news: Nearly 2/3 of Americans in a recent poll said they expect their personal finances to be better next year, the highest level in nearly two decades. More than half believe they are “better off than just a year ago.”

The Intermediate-Range Nuclear Forces (INF) Treaty has been an important pillar of global stability for three decades, but the U.S. cannot bind itself to a treaty when the other party is in clear violation. However, let’s not stop trying, let’s not let a new arms race begin. #INF
